summary: This document is a multi-page itemized telephone bill for an account, covering calls from October 31 to November 9, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from locations in New York, including White Plains, the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, and New York City. The bill includes calls to customer service, directory assistance, and numerous mobile-to-mobile calls. This document is a detailed telephone billing record (pages 57-69 of 73) for an account, showing itemized local, long distance, and international call charges from November 9-17, 2006. The calls originate primarily from White Plains, NY, with frequent calls to Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, and New York City numbers, indicating extensive communication activity during this period. This document is a series of T-Mobile phone bill pages showing itemized call details for an account from November 18-27, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from the 'White Pls, NY' area, with many calls being mobile-to-mobile. The document is significant as it provides a detailed communication log that could be used to establish patterns of contact and location during the investigation. This document is a multi-page itemized telephone bill for a T-Mobile account, covering late November and early December 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from a location in White Plains, NY, with other calls to New York City boroughs. The document appears to be part of financial records seized or subpoenaed in the investigation. This document is a detailed telephone billing record (pages 54-66 of 72) for an account, showing itemized local, long distance, and international call charges from December 9-18, 2006. The calls are predominantly to/from White Plains, NY, and the Bronx, NYC, NY, with many mobile-to-mobile calls. It appears to be a financial record subpoenaed for the investigation, likely to establish communication patterns and locations. This document is a detailed telephone billing record (pages 67-71 of 72) showing itemized local airtime, long distance, and international charges for an account. It logs numerous calls made and received on December 18-20, 2006, primarily to/from locations in New York City, including White Plains, the Bronx, Queens, and Brooklyn. The record shows a high volume of mobile-to-mobile calls and directory assistance calls. This document appears to be a detailed telephone billing record, likely for a mobile phone, covering the period from December 20 to December 31, 2006. It shows numerous calls made to and from locations in New York, primarily the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, and White Plains, with associated charges. The document is part of the Epstein case financial records, potentially used to establish patterns of communication or location data.

keyFacts: The document is a detailed telephone bill spanning from October 31, 2006, to November 9, 2006.
It shows an extremely high frequency of calls, often multiple calls per minute, concentrated in the New York metropolitan area.
The call destinations are primarily White Plains, NY, and the Bronx, NY, with other calls to Queens, Brooklyn, and Manhattan.
The bill includes calls to directory assistance (411) and customer service numbers.
The document is dated November 21, 2006, and appears to be a billing statement for a mobile phone account.
The document is a T-Mobile phone bill dated November 21, 2006, detailing call activity from November 9-17, 2006.

Calls were frequently made to destinations in the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, and New York City, indicating a geographic focus in the New York metropolitan area.
Several incoming calls are listed as 'Blocked NBR' (Blocked Number), suggesting attempts at anonymity from some callers.
The document is part of a larger 73-page record, implying extensive telecommunication data was collected for this account.
